Instead of face-to-face meetings, all interviews will be via phone and we can guide you through submitting your documents online.

Are you an experienced SEN Teaching Assistant looking for your next role in Islington?

Tradewind are currently recruiting for a SEN Teaching Assistant to join a delightful Primary School in Islington from September 2020. This is a full time, long-term role to work until the end of the academic year. You will be working on a 1:1 basis with a child with autism providing support to their learning and working alongside the class teacher. You will also assist preparing the classroom for lessons and activities. You will need to have excellent behaviour management skills and be able to use your own initiative as well as work as part of a team.

As a SEN Teaching Assistant for this role, you must have the following:

at least 2 years' experience working in a primary school.
must have experience working with children with SEN.
a recognised qualification up to Level 3 or any relevant qualifications.
possess excellent communication skills.
encouraging and caring personality.
The School - Islington

The school is a community school located in the heart of Islington. It is a two-form entry primary school with a nursery attached. Having recently relocated to a new building, the school is a modern fit for children's education with lots of outdoor and indoor space, fantastic facilities including a library and the latest ICT equipment.

If you feel you match the above criteria, please get in touch with Annie at Tradewind on or email

Tradewind are recruiting! Are you an experienced Year 5 Teacher looking for your next role in Hackney, London?

Tradewind Recruitment are currently recruiting for an ambitious and professional Year 5 Teacher to join this friendly primary school in Hackney from September 2020. This is a full-time, long-term position until the end of the academic year working in Year 5 with the possibility of becoming permanent.

The two-form entry primary school is a part of a federation in Hackney in partnership with two other primary schools in Hackney. This school has been graded by Ofsted as 'Outstanding' and are recognised for the exceptional achievement the pupils make.

The school are looking for:

A hardworking Year 5 Teacher who is ambitious and encourages children.

A dedicated person who has high expectations about what children can achieve and the subject knowledge to enable children to rise to these.

Has a professional outlook and is a team player.
Patient and caring and have real passion on leading young children to start their secondary education.

You will be working with a supportive and motivated staff team who are friendly and values all members of staff. The school invests a lot of time into the community, organising seasonal fairs and volunteering at local care centers. The school has excellent public transport links, with access to buses and tubes.

To be successful in this role you will need to:

Hold QTS status or equivalent teaching qualification.

At least 2 years' minimum experience working in KS2.

Sound knowledge of the British curriculum.

This position is subject to an Enhanced DBS disclosure, Overseas Police Clearance (if applicable) and professional reference checks.

Your CV must cover the last 10 years of employment history where possible and any employment breaks must be explained.

You must have the legal right to work in the UK.

If you would like further information on this role, please contact Annie at Tradewind on or email

Senior UX Designer- Manchester- HTML, CSS, UI, UX - £45,000 + Flexible working hours, bonus scheme, share options and progression opportunity...

The Role

A Senior UX Designer (HTML, CSS, UI, UX) is required to join a forward thinking, stable and creative digital agency in Central Manchester that is being heavily covered in the media for their innovative use of technology, growth and overwhelming sucess. As Senior UX Designer (HTML, CSS, UI, UX) you will build interactive and impressive UI and data visualisation that are intuitive for users. You will also work across the business with Project Managers, Business Analysts, Development and Design teams to develop, test and iterate UI/UX designs to a high quality.

As the Senior UX Designer (HTML, CSS, UI, UX)you will be working as part of a collaberative, creative and forward thinking business and therefore communication and creativity is key and you will be encouraged to use your experience and opinions to shape a million pound product.

Senior UX Designer Requirements

  • Commercial experience in a design capacity utilising UI/UX principals
  • Front-end development skills using HTML, CSS AND JavaScript would be beneficial but not essential

The Company

An industry leading digital agency focused on customer engagement and relationships delivering large scale projects for a multitude of clients across retail, technology, automotive and more. Benefits with this role include

  • Flexible working hours & remote working
  • A competitive remuneration package
  • Generous bonus scheme (Paid annually, last year £11000
  • Pension scheme
  • Flu Jab and medical cover
  • 25 days holiday + 8 bank holidays + buy and sell
  • Cycle to work scheme
  • Bonus scheme

Senior UX Designer- Manchester- HTML, CSS, UI, UX - £45,000 + Flexible working hours, bonus scheme, share options and progression opportunity...

Oscar Technology is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

To understand more about what we do with your data please review our privacy policy at https://our-privacy-policy.

Prospero Teaching is looking for an online ESOL Tutor that speaks Tigrinya to support pupils develop their English Language skills.

As an experienced ESOL Lecturer/Tutor you will be responsible for delivering online classes of effective teaching and learning for Pre-Entry Level to Entry Level 2 pupils. You will deliver high quality teaching sessions and motivate learners to raise their ambitions and realise their full potential.

Information on how the tutoring scheme works:

- Tuition work is completely flexible, you are able to commit to as much or as little tuition work as you wish.

- Salaries are paid on an hourly basis and will be dependent on your experience and qualifications £20 to £25 per hour.

- Due to the nature of this work, it is essential that you are able to plan, deliver and report back on tuition sessions on a weekly basis to a high standard.

- Our tuition packages are designed to promote attainment, support reintegration and maximise education opportunities.

Please note that any person contacted for tuition work will be subject to pre-employment checks in line with safer recruitment practices when working with children and young people, therefore you cannot work until you have completed a full registration.

Requirements for the position:

  • Able to speak Tigrinya
    * Relevant qualification i.e. ESOL, CELTA, TEFL, TESL, TESOL
    * Experience tutoring EAL pupils within the last year
  • Highly motivated and focused on achieving the best for every student.

    To be eligible for the 1:1 tutor position through Prospero Teaching you must:

    * Hold Right to Work in the UK
    * Hold an enhanced DBS certificate registered with the online update service or be willing to process a new application
    * Provide professional references covering your last 2 years of employment

    If you would like to be considered for this role, please apply with a copy of your up to date CV. Please note, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted

    Prospero Teaching is acting as an employment business/education recruitment agency in relation to this vacancy. The successful candidate will be required to register with Prospero Teaching in order to fill this vacancy.

    Prospero Teaching is able to offer the successful candidate:
    * Free, accredited continued professional development courses including safeguarding and behaviour management
    * In-house Training and Development Team

Are you looking for a new Teaching role in Early Years? Then Tradewind want you! Apply to this Early Years Teacher position at a great Primary School in Greenwich.

Tradewind are recruiting for an Early Years Teacher role starting September 2020 on a full time contract and the pay scale will Inner London MPS 1-6 (£30480 - £41483) and this will initially be a contract for 1 year.

This role will be a based in the Early Years department which is made up of a Nursery class as well as two Reception Classes. Students are encouraged through play to become independent, confident and creative.

This Primary School follows the Early Years Foundation Stage Curriculum which is suited to their young children who learn through play. The curriculum is broken down into seven areas of learning which all contribute and link together. These areas ensure children can learn and build strong relationships with others. The school also has a Forest set up and a trained Teacher in the Early Years department that delivers sessions outside. This is a inspirational process for the students that engages them so much in learning. The EYFS department is well resourced and a fantastic environment to learn for students, a lot of effort is put in by the staff to maintain displays and promote children work.

If you like the sounds of this Early Years Teacher role then apply now!

The successful candidate must hold a relevant Teaching qualification such as QTS as well as having recent experience as a Primary Teacher in an Early Years setting. We require two references on registration. You must have the legal right to work in the UK.

Click 'Apply Now' to be considered for this role as a Early Years Teacher in Greenwich. Or for more information about the role, contact Craig Sowden on or .

Tradewind are accepting applications for a Primary Teacher role at a wonderful Primary School in Greenwich. If you're looking for a new KS2 role for September 2020 then apply to this role.

Tradewind are recruiting for this Key Stage 2 Primary Teacher position to start in September 2020 on a full time contract and the pay scale will Inner London MPS 1-6 (£30480 - £41483). Initially this contract will be for 1 year.

This role will be a split role sharing a KS2 class 2 days per week and the other 3 days will be PPA/Intervention. The 3 days PPA/Intervention will be working across KS2 as well as with small groups to run interventions ensuring that work that hasn't been completed over this lockdown period is caught up and the gap in knowledge is reduced.

At this diverse community based Primary School they have very big ambitions. They want to involve the carers at home in the centre of the learning platform they provide. The school organises regular contact days for these people to share in success as well as get feedback from Senior Leaders and Teachers about each child and their progress. The aim is with all working together, everyone can achieve more. The school is making rapid progress and improvement due to high expectations, an innovative curriculum and clear approach to learning. They strive to ensure children feel safe and welcome, believing that the children come first. They involve them in a variety of projects that promote confidence and teamwork.

If you have these same high expectations and big ambitions then this is the school for you so apply now!

The successful candidate must hold a relevant Teaching qualification such as QTS as well as having recent experience as a Primary Teacher in KS2. We require two references on registration. You must have the legal right to work in the UK.

Click 'Apply Now' to be considered for this role as a Primary Teacher in Greenwich. Or for more information about the role, contact Craig Sowden on or .
